treatment_timeline.doctor: Dr. Jessica Koen or Not specified

actions.recommendation: As you get older (>40 years) - routine screening becomes important to help early detection & management of any irregularities. In males, this means regular prostate examinations and PSA blood levels. This is something to bear in mind in the next few years.

Overall there were a few areas we flagged as being risk factors for poor future health. Making these lifestyle changes - such as stopping smoking, reducing processed food intake, increasing veg/ fruits as well as forming good exercise routines - can have a positive impact on your long term health. It will help prevent chronic illness.
I am glad to hear that you are currently doing well with no concerns. If any complaints arise, to monitor and review with your GP. We will review you at your next medical.
